abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the  Statistical Development
            Project for Ghana were as follows: outcome was moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was significant,
            Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: (I) to provide the public with relevant
            and reliable statistics, the national statistical office
            needs a responsive governing body to give strategic
            direction; (ii) in supporting corporate or institutional
            reform agenda, it is essential to ensure orderly, efficient
            and effective implementation to minimize the impact on
            staff; (iii) it helps to ensure that all the technical
            assistance services are in place before the project is
            presented to the Board; (iv) the quality of project design,
            preparation, implementation and supervision all fell short
            of the norms for Bank operations; and (v) the check-list
            approach to monitoring and evaluation, as applied in this
            project, does not work.
